definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: Repeated hitting raised a large bruise.
sentences.chinese: 反复击打造成一大块青肿。

sentences.english: But you do need to hit every single shot with your arm.
sentences.chinese: 因此，你必须需要一个强壮的手臂来击打每一个回球。

sentences.english: The boxer feinted with his right hand and struck with his left hand.
sentences.chinese: 这个拳击手用右手佯攻而出左手击打。

sentences.english: This is achieved by striking left or right of the centre of the cue-ball.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以通过击打母球中心的左右来获得侧旋。

sentences.english: The ship was badly knocked about by storm.
sentences.chinese: 船被暴风雨击打得很厉害。

sentences.english: The rain drove across the windshield in sheets .
sentences.chinese: 大雨滂沱击打着挡风玻璃。

sentences.english: About ten days later, the Lord struck Nabal and he died.
sentences.chinese: 过了十天，耶和华击打拿八，他就死了。

sentences.english: The pins strike an inked ribbon and create an image on paper.
sentences.chinese: 这些针击打喷墨的色带并在纸上产生图像。

sentences.english: Do not practice in the form of stroking two balls in the fairway.
sentences.chinese: 请毋在球道内以击打两个球的形式进行练习。

sentences.english: Take note of the glass fogging up and the sound of the water hitting the shower door or curtain.
sentences.chinese: 留意玻璃蒙上水汽和水击打在淋浴门或门帘上的声音。

sentences.english: He batted the ball into the left field.
I went after it, struck it and rescued the sheep from its mouth.
sentences.chinese: 我就追赶它，击打它，将羊羔从它口中救出来。

sentences.english: If you hit it straight over the top, you get six runs.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在头顶上方击打的，你得六分。

sentences.english: Seven days passed after the Lord struck the Nile.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华击打河以后满了七天。

sentences.english: For every 3 - 5 minutes of consecutive punches, the artist makes one blindfolded mark.
sentences.chinese: 艺术家连续击打3至5分钟后，蒙上眼睛画一笔。

sentences.english: He blacked out after they hit him on the head.
sentences.chinese: 他们击打他的头之后，他晕过去了。

definition: to pat/to slap/(of a bird) to flap (one's wings)
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
to collide/jerking motion/to impinge/to offend/to provoke
